Description: Blue washed pottery shabti with black painted detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, a modelled face and crossed hands(worn) holding two hoes; Hieroglyphic text down the leg section; seed-basket at the back.
Curator's comments: This shabti, together with EA 67045 and EA 67046, likely comes from the 1895-96 Ramesseum excavation directed by Petrie and sponsored by the Egyptian Research Account. Although the original inscription is virtually illegible, a post-excavation label has been added to the reverse with the name ‘Ament-em-heb’, and Imn-m-hb (although without the ‘t’) appears in the list of names attested on shabtis from the site in Quibell 1898, The Ramesseum, pl. V. Three probably related examples with a firm provenance from the Ramsesseum excavation are in the collection of the World Museum, Liverpool: 52.55.118, 52.55.143 and 58.32.8.
